intro: Cestichis arachnites, commonly known as the spider orchid, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, spider-like appearance due to its elongated, filamentous flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellow, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Cestichis arachnites is a rare and protected species, highlighting its ecological significance in its native habitat.
